pub.citation: Howarth, D. G. et al. 2003. PHYLOGENETICS OF THE GENUS SCAEVOLA (GOODENIACEAE): IMPLICATION FOR DISPERSAL PATTERNS ACROSS THE PACIFIC BASIN AND COLONIZATION OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS. American Journal of Botany 90(6): 915-923.

pmmd.notes: Strict consensus of 864 most parsimonious trees. Bootstrap values are given above the branches. Asterisks indicate a lack of support for the clade under other weighting schemes. Section and subsection delineations based on Carolin et al. (1992) are indicated on the right (Enan. 5 Scaevola sect. Enantiophyllum; Xero. 5 Scaevola sect. Xerocarpa; Scae. 5 Scaevola sect. Scaevola;). Long dashes 5 single species dispersals, short dashes 5 Southern clade, medium dashes 5 Northern clade. SP 5 South Pacific, HI 5 Hawaiian Islands, SA 5 South America, A 5 Africa. Taxa in boldface type occur outside Australia.
